prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: -

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon successful completion of this course, students will:
  1. Have an increased understanding of the possibilities of sound and music as a way to convey and support narration, and, furthermore, getting acquainted with the diversity of how sound and music are used in narration and storytelling in different contexts and media.
  2. Have the ability to create audio content to support visual narration and to be able to argue for one's artistic and design decisions.

  2. Have the ability to create audio content to support visual narration and to be able to argue for one's artistic and design decisions.

  2. Have the ability to create audio content to support visual narration and to be able to argue for one's artistic and design decisions.

content.fi: The course is a lecture series given by professionals working with applied sound and music. The topics of the lectures range from interactive audiovisuals to contemporary art and from commercial radio to animation films and more, including latest technologies like VR.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon successful completion of this course, students will:
  1. Get acquainted with the history of electronic music instruments.
  2. Have the ability to create own music within the constraints of vintage electronic instruments.
  3. Have the ability to create and express ideas on scenarios of how music technology might develop in the future.
  4. Gain a broadened conception of what music is and what it could be.

content.fi: The course consists of two modules: the first one is devoted to exploring early synthesisers and using them to compose new music. The second one is focusing on philosophy and concepts of experimental music, ending at students' presentations

learningOutcomes.fi:
On successful completion of this course,
- students will learn about a range of key theories, ideas, and articulated positions from which curatorial approaches can be constructed.
- students will be able to critically evaluate different curatorial and artistic strategies from the viewpoint of socio-political transformation.
- students will be able to apply critical thinking skills to analyse and discuss the current challenges in the field of curatorial practice.

learningOutcomes.en:

- students will learn about a range of key theories, ideas, and articulated positions from which curatorial approaches can be constructed.

content.fi:
In the course Curatorial Theory Expanded, we will discuss key ideas that have shaped curatorial practice. The course thematic focus changes every year to respond to the current debates in art and curating. Examples of previous subjects explored and discussed in the course: social and environmental justice, digital materiality, decolonisation, feminism and intersectionality, etc.
Each different thematic focus allows us to explore expanded ways and modes of thinking about curating. 
The course fosters innovative thinking, acting as a laboratory and incubator for creative critical inquiry and future curatorial projects.

workload.fi:
Kurssin läpäiseminen vaatii vähintään 80 % läsnäoloa kontaktiopetuksessa. Mikäli opiskelija ei poissaolojen vuoksi saavuta kurssikuvauksessa määriteltyjä osaamistavoitteita, voi lopun 20 % joutua korvaamaan vastuuopettajien määrittelemällä tavalla. Kaikista poissaoloista pitää ilmoittaa vastuuopettajille ja korvaavista tehtävistä sovitaan vastuuopettajien kanssa. 
Osallistuminen opetuksen ensimmäiseen päivään pakollista.
Luennot, lähiopetus, työpajatyöskentely ja palaute 105 h
Itsenäinen työskentely ja/tai itsenäinen työskentely pienryhmässä 130 h
Opiskelijan itsenäinen tiedon prosessointi 8 h

learningOutcomes.fi:
Opiskelija
  • tuntee pitkän elokuvan käsikirjoittamisen yleisimmät työvaiheet henkilöhahmojen luomisesta aina tarinan kokonaisuuden hahmottamiseen,
  • tuntee klassisen elokuvadramaturgian yleisimmät konventiot ja osaa soveltaa niitä omassa käsikirjoitusprosessissa,
  • tuntee treatmentin kirjoittamisen tyylilajin ja osaa hyödyntää sitä omassa kirjoittamisessa,
  • osaa antaa ja vastaanottaa rakentavaa palautetta,
  • osaa eritellä oman taiteellisen prosessin vaiheita,
  • tietää millaisia työvaiheita pitkän elokuvan kirjoitusprosessiin tyypillisesti kuuluu

workload.fi:
Kurssin läpäiseminen vaatii vähintään 80 % läsnäoloa kontaktiopetuksessa. Mikäli opiskelija ei poissaolojen vuoksi saavuta kurssikuvauksessa määriteltyjä osaamistavoitteita, voi lopun 20 % joutua korvaamaan vastuuopettajien määrittelemällä tavalla. Kaikista poissaoloista pitää ilmoittaa vastuuopettajille ja korvaavista tehtävistä sovitaan vastuuopettajien kanssa. 
Osallistuminen opetuksen ensimmäiseen päivään pakollista.
Luennot, lähiopetus ja palaute 16 h
Itsenäinen työskentely ja/tai itsenäinen työskentely pienryhmässä 55 h
Opiskelijan itsenäinen tiedon prosessointi 2 h
Katselut, presentaatiot, palautekeskustelut 8 h

learningOutcomes.fi:
- Students will identify the main aspects that pertain to documentary film ethics.
- Students will be able to identify the main debates around practices and politics of representation.
- Students will be able to analyze films attending either to the ethical challenges they present for filmmakers and audiences, or to wider questions of documentary representation.

content.fi: This course will look at issues of representation in documentary filmmaking. The course will cover issues relating to the ethics of representation in documentary film and other “reality” based practices. The course might cover issues of representing culture, ethnicity, gender and minority communities as well as wider theories and practices of documentary representation.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of the course, students are able to:
-Identify basic concepts and theories related to costume research.
-Critically reflect on issues relating to the theory and practice of costume design.
-Identify methodological approaches to research costume and dress, and select methods suitable to answer research questions related to the students' interests or personal perspective.
-Use different tools and methods to collect data and search information from different sources, including from individuals.
-Recognize terminology related to costume studies as an scholarly discipline.
-Consider ethical aspects related to research in the field of costume.
-Present and synthesize findings of their individual research work in oral and written ways.

content.fi: Students are introduced to basic theoretical concepts related to costume research, and to tools, methods and approaches for the development of a personal research-oriented enquiry. The course content varies each year to include theoretical approaches to costume and performance from the perspective of different scholars and artists. It may also include introductory sessions to research methods for costume and dress and to different perspectives for the study of costume, such as material culture, collection-based research in archives and museums, visual analysis and semiotics, ethnographic approaches, oral history, and creative practice. The course includes lectures and presentations on special aspects of costume history, theory and practice and in related areas that expand the understanding of costume in inter-disciplinary ways. The students work on a subject of their choice to critically reflect on costume in live or mediated performance and to develop a personal research approach. The course includes student presentations and written essays.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of the course, the students are able to:
- Identify global dress/fashion styles and how these can be used from a costume designer's perspective.
- Recognise period dress styles, forms and cuts, and define garments and accessories using approriate terminology.
- Relate dress and style with the historical, socio-political, economic and cultural context of a diversity of places and periods.
- Analyse style in-depth, including use of materials, body posture, habits and social manners in different time periods.
- Collect and evaluate sources relevant to period costume from broader cultural history, including the history of art and architecture.
learningOutcomes.sv: Upon completion of the course, the students are able to:- Identify global dress/fashion styles and how these can be used from a costume designer's perspective.- Recognise period dress styles, forms and cuts, and define garments and accessories using approriate terminology.- Relate dress and style with the historical, socio-political, economic and cultural context of a diversity of places and periods.- Analyse style in-depth, including use of materials, body posture, habits and social manners in different time periods.- Collect and evaluate sources relevant to period costume from broader cultural history, including the history of art and architecture.
learningOutcomes.en: Upon completion of the course, the students are able to:- Identify global dress/fashion styles and how these can be used from a costume designer's perspective.- Recognise period dress styles, forms and cuts, and define garments and accessories using approriate terminology.- Relate dress and style with the historical, socio-political, economic and cultural context of a diversity of places and periods.- Analyse style in-depth, including use of materials, body posture, habits and social manners in different time periods.- Collect and evaluate sources relevant to period costume from broader cultural history, including the history of art and architecture.

content.fi: The course provides an advanced study of period costume and style, and of the meanings of fashion and dress codes in different times relating European fashion history and global regions to the history of art. The course examines the development of dress from the beginnings of mankind to contemporary times and provides a deep understanding of periods and the reasons that formed specific dress styles. It focuses on the socio-political, economic and cultural context of the development of dress and costume on and beyond the stage, from a cultural history perspective that builds upon prior knowledge of the history of design.The course analyzes the elements that create the style of each period, such as forms, colours, materials, and decorative themes as well as additional elements that complement style, such as body posture, manners and the use of accessories. During the course, the students practice on identifying these elements and finding sources for the collection of information for the style of a diversity of periods. The course encourages a research-approach to the subject and entails independent work. It includes lectures, design-based and written assignments and a personal research task to be submitted as final assignment.

content.fi: The course uses a wide range of technical resources from traditional drawn and stop motion animation to the latest digitally generated imagery. The course focuses on practice-based knowledge that can be applied to different technical processes rather than on a software-specific skill. It advances the core understanding of character animation principles while the students investigate different character animation traditions and reflect them on their own work. The students will also attend specific acting for animation and life drawing workshops.
content.sv: The course uses a wide range of technical resources from traditional drawn and stop motion animation to the latest digitally generated imagery. The course focuses on practice-based knowledge that can be applied to different technical processes rather than on a software-specific skill. It advances the core understanding of character animation principles while the students investigate different character animation traditions and reflect them on their own work. The students will also attend specific acting for animation and life drawing workshops.
content.en: The course uses a wide range of technical resources from traditional drawn and stop motion animation to the latest digitally generated imagery. The course focuses on practice-based knowledge that can be applied to different technical processes rather than on a software-specific skill. It advances the core understanding of character animation principles while the students investigate different character animation traditions and reflect them on their own work. The students will also attend specific acting for animation and life drawing workshops.

learningOutcomes.fi:
1 soveltaa tasapainoisesti ja kriittisesti teoreettista ja kokemuksellista tietoa taiteen, median ja kulttuurin alueilla käytettävistä erilaisista tekstilajeista
2 arvioida ja käyttää kriittisesti erilaisia lähdemateriaaleja ja soveltaa erilaisia lukemisen ja kirjoittamisen menetelmiä omassa taiteellisessa ja tutkimuksellisessa työskentelyssään
3 tunnistaa ja hyödyntää tekstilajeja, kirjoitustekniikoita, materiaaleja, työskentelymetodeja sekä teoreettisia käsitteitä, jotka tukevat hänen taiteellista ja kirjallista praktiikkaansa
learningOutcomes.sv:
1 soveltaa tasapainoisesti ja kriittisesti teoreettista ja kokemuksellista tietoa taiteen, median ja kulttuurin alueilla käytettävistä erilaisista tekstilajeista
2 arvioida ja käyttää kriittisesti erilaisia lähdemateriaaleja ja soveltaa erilaisia lukemisen ja kirjoittamisen menetelmiä omassa taiteellisessa ja tutkimuksellisessa työskentelyssään
3 tunnistaa ja hyödyntää tekstilajeja, kirjoitustekniikoita, materiaaleja, työskentelymetodeja sekä teoreettisia käsitteitä, jotka tukevat hänen taiteellista ja kirjallista praktiikkaansa
learningOutcomes.en: 1 apply theoretical and practical knowledge of different text genres in a balanced and critical manner within their professional field in arts, media and culture2 critically assess and use source material and apply different reading and writing methods to their own artistic and scholarly work3 recognize and utilize text genres, writing techniques, materials, working methods and concepts that support their visual and textual practice

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssi syventää opiskelijan tietämystä valokuvateorian keskeisistä teemoista ja keskusteluista. Opiskelija saa käsityksen keskeisistä ajattelijoista ja heidän teorioistaan, sekä joistain kiistanalaisemmista, ja oppivat suhteuttamaan teoriat niiden omaan aikaan sekä nykyvalokuvataiteen ilmiöihin. Kurssi kehittää opiskelijan kykyä teoreettiseen ajatteluun ja näkemään teorian merkityksen omassa valokuvaustyössään. Opintojakso tukee opinnäytteeseen liittyvää tiedollista prosessia. Tavoitteena on valokuvaan liittyvän teoreettisen ajattelun ja keskustelun tuntemus. Lisäksi harjoitellaan valokuvateoreettista kirjoittamista ja lähdekirjallisuuden käyttöä, tavoitteena oman kriittisen ajattelun kehittäminen.
learningOutcomes.sv: Kurssi syventää opiskelijan tietämystä valokuvateorian keskeisistä teemoista ja keskusteluista. Opiskelija saa käsityksen keskeisistä ajattelijoista ja heidän teorioistaan, sekä joistain kiistanalaisemmista, ja oppivat suhteuttamaan teoriat niiden omaan aikaan sekä nykyvalokuvataiteen ilmiöihin. Kurssi kehittää opiskelijan kykyä teoreettiseen ajatteluun ja näkemään teorian merkityksen omassa valokuvaustyössään. Opintojakso tukee opinnäytteeseen liittyvää tiedollista prosessia. Tavoitteena on valokuvaan liittyvän teoreettisen ajattelun ja keskustelun tuntemus. Lisäksi harjoitellaan valokuvateoreettista kirjoittamista ja lähdekirjallisuuden käyttöä, tavoitteena oman kriittisen ajattelun kehittäminen.
learningOutcomes.en: The course deepens the student ́s knowledge about the theory of photography, its central themes and main debates. Students become aware of the established key thinkers and their theories, as well as more controversial ones, and learn to contextualize the theories within their time and in relation to phenomena of contemporary photography. The course develops the student's ability for theoretical thinking and seeing the connections of theory to their own photographic practice. The course supports MA master thesis work and its cognitive processes, aiming at good knowledge of theoretical discourses of photography. The student's writing, research and critical thinking skills are developed in the course assignments.

content.fi: Kurssilla tutustutaan valokuvateorian tärkeimpiin käsitteisiin ja keskusteluihin. Keskeiset ajattelijat ja heidän teoriansa esitellään (esim. Walter Benjamin, Roland Barthes, Vilém Flusser, Susan Sontag) sekä useita muita teoreettisia lähestymiskulmia (esim. psykoanalyysi, dekonstruktio, simulaatioteoriat, ei-inhimillinen valokuvaus). Tarkastelun kohteena on sekä teorioita, jotka liittyvät valokuvan sekä eri käytäntöihin että valokuvan ontologiaan. Kurssilla pohditaan siirtymää perinteisemmistä, representaatioon perustuvista valokuvateorioista, kohti valokuvan nykyisiä teknologioita ja hajaannusta paremmin kuvaavia teorioita. Kurssilla huomioidaan myös vaihtoehtoiset teoreettisen kirjoittamisen tavat (autoetnografia, fiktokritiikki) ja taiteelliseen tutkimukseen liittyvät valokuvateoreettiset kysymykset.
content.sv: Kurssilla tutustutaan valokuvateorian tärkeimpiin käsitteisiin ja keskusteluihin. Keskeiset ajattelijat ja heidän teoriansa esitellään (esim. Walter Benjamin, Roland Barthes, Vilém Flusser, Susan Sontag) sekä useita muita teoreettisia lähestymiskulmia (esim. psykoanalyysi, dekonstruktio, simulaatioteoriat, ei-inhimillinen valokuvaus). Tarkastelun kohteena on sekä teorioita, jotka liittyvät valokuvan sekä eri käytäntöihin että valokuvan ontologiaan. Kurssilla pohditaan siirtymää perinteisemmistä, representaatioon perustuvista valokuvateorioista, kohti valokuvan nykyisiä teknologioita ja hajaannusta paremmin kuvaavia teorioita. Kurssilla huomioidaan myös vaihtoehtoiset teoreettisen kirjoittamisen tavat (autoetnografia, fiktokritiikki) ja taiteelliseen tutkimukseen liittyvät valokuvateoreettiset kysymykset.
content.en: The course explores the key concepts of photography theory, its central themes and main debates. The canonical key photography theorists and writers are introduced (e.g. Walter Benjamin, Roland Barthes, Vilém Flusser, Susan Sontag) as well as a variety of other theoretical approaches (e.g. psychoanalysis, deconstruction, theories of simulation, non-human photography). Both theories related to particular photographic practices as well as philosophies about photographic ontology are addressed. The shifts from the traditional and representational theories of photography to the fragmented contemporary ones are acknowledged. In the course attention is also given to alternative ways of theoretical writing (e.g. autoethnography, fictocriticism) and to questions of artistic research in relation to photography theory.

learningOutcomes.fi: Opintojakson käytyään opiskelija osaa tunnistaa ja paikantaa sekä maantieteellisesti että historiallisesti länsimaisen arkkitehtuurin historian ilmentymiä. Hän pystyy analysoimaan esimerkkikohteita ja käyttämään arkkitehtuurin historian perussanastoa.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter slutförd kurs kan den studerande identifiera den västerländska arkitekturhistoriens yttringar samt placera dem i sitt geografiska och historiska sammanhang. Vidare kan hen analysera enskilda objekt och använda grundläggande arkitekturhistoriska termer.
learningOutcomes.en: After completing the course, students will be able to identify and localize, both geographically and historically, historical expressions of western architecture. They will be able to analyze building examples and utilize the basic vocabulary of the history of architecture.

content.fi: Luentosarja antaa yleiskuvan länsimaisen rakennustaiteen ja kaupunkirakentamisen kehityksestä antiikista nykypäivään. Tarkasteltavaa arkkitehtuuria lähestytään osana fyysistä ja sosiaalista ympäristöään. Tarkastelu ulotetaan rakennukset toteuttaneeseen yhteisöön, ajan esteettisiin ihanteisiin sekä rakennustekniikkoihin ja -materiaaleihin.
content.sv: Föreläsningarna ger en övergripande bild av den västerländska byggnadskonsten och stadsutvecklingen från antiken till nutid. Arkitekturen studeras som en del av sin fysiska och sociala miljö med hänsyn till rådande samhälle, estetiska ideal samt byggnadstekniker och -material.
content.en: The lecture series provides a general view of the development of western architecture and the urban environment from ancient times to the present. The architecture in question is approached as a whole, as part of its physical and social surroundings. The study extends to the society that has carried out the buildings, the aesthetic ideals of the time and the building techniques and materials.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Suoritettuaan kurssin opiskelija 1. ymmärtää opinnäytteen osana omia pääaineopintojaan;
2. tuntee opinnäyteohjeen ja sekä yhteiset että omaan ohjelmaansa/pääaineeseensa liittyvät prosessit ja aikataulun ja osaa soveltaa niitä omaan opinnäyteprosessiinsa;
3. kykenee suunnittelemaan ja viemään läpi itsenäisen opinnäyteprosessin.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter godkänd kurs kan studenten
1. Förstå vad lärdomsprovet är i deras studieprogram/huvudämne;2. Tolka anvisningar för lärdomsprovet, processer och tidslinjer som är relevanta för deras studieprogram/huvudämne och tillämpa dem på sin egen uppsatsprocess;3. Planera och genomföra ett självständigt lärdomsprovet.
learningOutcomes.en:
After completing the course, the student is able to
  1. Understand what a Master’s thesis is in their study programme/major;
  2. Interpret the Master’s thesis guidelines, processes, and timelines relevant for their study programme/major and apply them to their own thesis process;
  3. Plan and execute an independent thesis project.

content.fi:
Opinnäyteseminaari (Thesis Seminar) on pakollinen kurssi kaikille muotoilun laitoksen maisteriopiskelijoille toisena opiskeluvuotena. Opiskelija aloittaa opinnäytepolun ilmoittautumalla opinnäyteseminaariin, joka tukee hänen työskentelyään koko prosessin ajan. Kurssin ensimmäisillä kerroilla opiskelija tutustuu opinnäytteen ohjeisiin ja erityyppisiin opinnäytteisiin, määrittelee opinnäytteensä aiheen, etsii valvojan ja ohjaajan sekä laatii opinnäytesuunnitelmansa. Opiskelijat suorittavat osat 1 ja 2 noudattaen valitsemansa opinnäytepolun aikataulua.  Kurssi päättyy osan 3 esittelyyn, ennen kuin opiskelija jättää opinnäytteensä.
Kurssi järjestetään kaksi kertaa vuodessa: periodeilla I-V ja  III-V. Kurssin toteuttaa osittain Muotoilun laitos ja osittain ohjelmat/pääaineet.
Opinnäyteseminaari on yksi neljästä yhteisestä kurssista, jotka ovat pakollisia kaikille Muotoilun laitoksen opiskelijoille. Muut ovat INTRO, Design Research ja Design Culture Now.
content.sv:
Thesis Seminar är en obligatorisk kurs för alla masterstudenter vid Institutionen för design under sitt andra studieår. Studenten startar sin lärdomsprovet genom att anmäla sig till Thesis Seminar, som kommer att stödja deras arbete under hela processen. Under kursens första sessioner bekantar sig studenterna med anvisningar för lärdomsprovet och olika typer av lärdomsprovet, definierar sitt tema, hittar en övervakare och handledare och förbereder sin plan for lärdomsprovet. Studenter arbetar och genomför delprestationer 1 och 2 genom att följa schemat för den implemenation de har anmält sig i. Kursen avslutas med en del 3-presentation, innan studenten lämnar in sin lärdomsprovet.
Kursen anordnas två gånger per år: under perioderna I-V, och perioderna III-V. Thesis Seminar organiseras dels av Institutionen för design (gemensamma sessioner), dels av programmen/major för att stödja sina studenters specifika uppsatsinnehåll.
Thesis Seminar är en av de fyra gemensamma kurserna som är obligatoriska för alla MA-studenter vid Institutionen för design, andra är INTRO, Design Culture Now och Design Research.
content.en:
Thesis Seminar is a mandatory course for all Master’s students at the Department of Design in their 2nd study year. The student starts their thesis journey by registering for Thesis Seminar, which will support their work throughout their thesis process. During the first sessions of the course, students familiarise with the thesis guidelines and different types of theses, define their thesis topic, find a supervisor and advisor, and prepare their Thesis Plan. Students work and complete Part 1 and Part 2 by following the schedule of the path they have registered in. The course ends with a Part 3 presentation, before the student submits their final thesis.
 
The course is organised twice a year: during the periods I-V, and periods III-V. The course activities are organised partly by the Department of Design (joint sessions), and partly by the programmes/majors to support their students’ specific thesis contents.
Thesis Seminar is one of the four joint courses compulsory for all MA students at the Department of Design, others being INTRO, Design Culture Now and Design Research (1st year).

assesmentMethods.en: 100% active attendance of all six thesis seminar sessions, completion of course assignments, and the thesis Part 3 presentation are required to pass the course.

name.sv: Ways of Making 1 - Mold making & casting techniques, Föreläsning
name.en: Ways of Making 1 - Mold making & casting techniques, Lecture

workload.fi: 3 weeks of very intensive course, exhibition building and critique. Student is expected to be present during all contact teaching days, as well as complete self-directed tasks.92 h contact teaching including lectures, 22 h independent work / 48 h time to think
workload.sv: 3 weeks of very intensive course, exhibition building and critique. Student is expected to be present during all contact teaching days, as well as complete self-directed tasks.92 h contact teaching including lectures, 22 h independent work / 48 h time to think

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Studio A, Studio B or similar
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Studio A, Studio B or similar
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Studio A, Studio B or similar

learningOutcomes.fi: Through short creative projects, the student will become familiar with moldmaking and casting techniques, and understand which types of form can be reproduced with different casting materials and techniques.
learningOutcomes.sv: Through short creative projects, the student will become familiar with moldmaking and casting techniques, and understand which types of form can be reproduced with different casting materials and techniques.
learningOutcomes.en: Through short creative projects, the student will become familiar with moldmaking and casting techniques, and understand which types of form can be reproduced with different casting materials and techniques.

content.fi:
The course concentrates on mold making techniques, as well as mold and casting materials.Students learn to make molds using a variety of materials and forms, learn one-piece and multi-piece moldmaking, and to perceive which mold and casting material is most suitable for which purpose.Depending on the student's project, the following mold techniques are studied: Single and multiple-use molds from plaster, soft molds from silicon and alginate mold. Casting materials such as plaster, concrete, wax and acrylic resin are investigated. Two sessions will be spent working in the glass studios. 
There will be an exhibition in the end of the course that will showcase the artworks created during the course.
content.sv:
The course concentrates on mold making techniques, as well as mold and casting materials.Students learn to make molds using a variety of materials and forms, learn one-piece and multi-piece moldmaking, and to perceive which mold and casting material is most suitable for which purpose.Depending on the student's project, the following mold techniques are studied: Single and multiple-use molds from plaster, soft molds from silicon and alginate mold. Casting materials such as plaster, concrete, wax and acrylic resin are investigated. Two sessions will be spent working in the glass studios. 
There will be an exhibition in the end of the course that will showcase the artworks created during the course.
content.en:
The course concentrates on mold making techniques, as well as mold and casting materials.Students learn to make molds using a variety of materials and forms, learn one-piece and multi-piece moldmaking, and to perceive which mold and casting material is most suitable for which purpose.Depending on the student's project, the following mold techniques are studied: Single and multiple-use molds from plaster, soft molds from silicon and alginate mold. Casting materials such as plaster, concrete, wax and acrylic resin are investigated. Two sessions will be spent working in the glass studios. 
There will be an exhibition in the end of the course that will showcase the artworks created during the course.

additionalInformation.fi:
Teaching Language: English Teaching Period: 2024-2025 Summer   2025-2026 Summer  Registration: Priority order in course registration  1. Students in Sculpture minor 2. Degree Students in ARTS
Minimum amount of participants is 8 students. Maximum amount of participants is 15 students.
After the registration has closed, SISU conducts a raffle to allocate all the seats while considering the possible prioritisation order stated above. If there are more registrants than available seats, ten (10) students from the remaining applicants are drawn and placed on a waiting list in numerical order. On the first day of the course, these students may check for available seats in case of no-shows. Any available seats are then filled in numerical order. Students on the waiting list will receive an email containing details about the registration status, once the registration period has closed.

workload.fi: Luennot, työpajatyöskentely, ryhmäkeskustelut, palautekeskustelut, presentaatiot, kirjoittaminen ja kehittely työryhmissä tai itsenäisesti. Kurssin läpäiseminen vaatii vähintään 80 % läsnäoloa kontaktiopetuksessa. Mikäli opiskelija ei poissaolojen vuoksi saavuta kurssikuvauksessa määriteltyjä osaamistavoitteita, voi lopun 20 % joutua korvaamaan vastuuopettajien määrittelemällä tavalla. Kaikista poissaoloista pitää ilmoittaa vastuuopettajille ja korvaavista tehtävistä sovitaan vastuuopettajien kanssa.

Kaikista poissaoloista pitää ilmoittaa vastuuopettajille ja korvaavista tehtävistä sovitaan vastuuopettajien kanssa.
workload.en: Lectures, workshopping, group discussions, feedback sessions, presentations, writing and development exercises in smaller groups or independently. At least 80% participation in face-to-face teaching is mandatory to complete the course. If, due to absences, the student does not achieve the learning outcomes defined in the course description, the remaining 20% may have to be compensated as determined by the responsible teachers of the course. All absences must be reported to the teachers in charge. The responsible teachers of the course will specify the necessary compensating assignments.

Projektien ja yhtiötason tunnuslukujen tarkastelu tavalla, joka tukee kestävää tuotanto- ja liiketoimintaa projektilähtöisessä toimintaympäristössä.

Projektien ja yhtiötason tunnuslukujen tarkastelu tavalla, joka tukee kestävää tuotanto- ja liiketoimintaa projektilähtöisessä toimintaympäristössä.
learningOutcomes.en: Managing audiovisual projects, slate of several projects and the economy of production companies in light of figures. Budgeting, financing plans and cashflow seen from the point of view of both projects and the company in an effort to create sustainable productions and business models within the industry.

learningOutcomes.en:
Upon successful completion of the course, students will be able to:
  • understand and use basic research vocabulary
  • compose a research plan

content.en:
Doing Research in Art and Media is a compulsory joint course that introduces students to research practices, key research methods and relevant inquiries in the field of Art and Media. The course includes tasks and activities that range from critical thinking and  reading, writing, presenting, and peer-reviewing research.
If exceptional circumstances prevent you from taking this course in your first year, please contact the responsible teachers.

name.fi: Reading Seminar on Art and the Political, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Reading Seminar on Art and the Political, Föreläsning
name.en: Reading Seminar on Art and the Political, Lecture

workload.fi: During the reading seminar the participant read selected essays,  books, articles, and other publications on artistic and practice-based  research, prepare to discuss and also summarize to other students the  content of the materials they have read.3 ECTS = 20 hours contact teaching: seminars, discussions, 61 hours independent reading.
workload.sv: During the reading seminar the participant read selected essays,  books, articles, and other publications on artistic and practice-based  research, prepare to discuss and also summarize to other students the  content of the materials they have read.3 ECTS = 20 hours contact teaching: seminars, discussions, 61 hours independent reading.
workload.en: During the reading seminar the participant read selected essays,  books, articles, and other publications on artistic and practice-based  research, prepare to discuss and also summarize to other students the  content of the materials they have read.3 ECTS = 20 hours contact teaching: seminars, discussions, 61 hours independent reading.

learningOutcomes.fi: During the reading seminar on art and the political participants will become acquainted with texts by contemporary and other theorists who have examined some of the key relationships and manifestations between art and "the political".
learningOutcomes.sv: During the reading seminar on art and the political participants will become acquainted with texts by contemporary and other theorists who have examined some of the key relationships and manifestations between art and "the political".
learningOutcomes.en: During the reading seminar on art and the political participants will become acquainted with texts by contemporary and other theorists who have examined some of the key relationships and manifestations between art and "the political".

content.fi:
The aim is to delve into shared texts, engage in discussions, and problematize the debated notion of the politics of aesthetics. How can we reimagine the counterstrategies of filmmaking or other arts in the contemporary context? How can art-making become a strategy in addressing counter-history or counter-memory? The reading seminar aims to provide conceptual frameworks to contemplate the relationship between artistic practices and the pressing political, societal, and ethical challenges of our time. Through discussions, participants will find new ideas and concepts to articulate the foundations of their own art-making. During the reading seminar, each student writes
an essay relating to the themes of their own doctoral research. The reading
seminar is aimed at doctoral students working on an artistic or practice-based
doctoral research project but also open for everyone interested, also for MA
students.  The starting point is the idea
that artistic research is an investigative activity where philosophical and
other literary references and experimentation within artistic practice are in
dialogue with each other.

learningOutcomes.fi: The objective of the course is to give students the key tools for analyzing, valuing and risk managing fixed income securities and derivatives, understanding the practical applications of such concepts, and being able to study current issues in the fixed income markets. The course will be useful to students interested in careers in banking, financial services, investment management, corporate financial management, or in the academia.

content.fi: Topics discussed include the global fixed income market structure, valuation of key instruments traded in both government bond and credit markets including derivatives such as options, futures, swaps and structured products, interest rate risk management and modelling as well as the impact of macroeconomic events on fixed income markets. The course will cover theoretical models and concepts as well as practical applications and analysis.

All other M.Sc. students at the School of Business Please follow carefully the registration deadlines of the courses and exams! Missing registration deadline automatically foregoes a guaranteed seat for Finance M.Sc. courses and puts prospective student at the bottom of the prioritization list.

learningOutcomes.fi: The objective of the course is to give students the key tools for analyzing, valuing and risk managing fixed income securities and derivatives, understanding the practical applications of such concepts, and being able to study current issues in the fixed income markets. The course will be useful to students interested in careers in banking, financial services, investment management, corporate financial management, or in the academia.

learningOutcomes.fi: Students will be able to identify the key issues and implications in the debate regarding the Efficient Markets Hypothesis; understand the key aspects of institutional investment policy; suggest solutions to business situations involving asset management; perform critical analysis of an investment strategy.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Introduction to Statistics (Tilastotieteen perusteet) and Rahoituksen perusteet or equivalent
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Introduction to Statistics (Tilastotieteen perusteet) and Rahoituksen perusteet or equivalent
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Introduction to Statistics (Tilastotieteen perusteet) and Rahoituksen perusteet or equivalent

learningOutcomes.fi: By the end of the course, students will be familiar with basic econometric methods; be able to implement these methods using the R language (http://www.r-project.org/); know how to interpret statistical results correctly and draw appropriate conclusions.
learningOutcomes.sv: By the end of the course, students will be familiar with basic econometric methods; be able to implement these methods using the R language (http://www.r-project.org/); know how to interpret statistical results correctly and draw appropriate conclusions.
learningOutcomes.en: By the end of the course, students will be familiar with basic econometric methods; be able to implement these methods using the R language (http://www.r-project.org/); know how to interpret statistical results correctly and draw appropriate conclusions.

content.fi: The course provides an introduction to the standard linear regression model, which is the core of econometrics. Topics include estimation by ordinary least squares (OLS), interpreting regression results, hypothesis testing, and misspecification issues. In addition to the standard regression model, we will look at event-study methodology, instrumental variables and panel data. This is an applied course, meaning that all topics will be illustrated by empirical examples related to investments and corporate finance using real data.

This is an applied course, meaning that all topics will be illustrated by empirical examples related to investments and corporate finance using real data.

In addition to the standard regression model, we will look at event-study methodology, instrumental variables and panel data. This is an applied course, meaning that all topics will be illustrated by empirical examples related to investments and corporate finance using real data.

Students of Aalto Finance B.Sc. programme and exchange students with Finance specialization at their home university will be admitted to the course. Students re-taking the course (grade already registered) will not be prioritized and can participate only if there are places remaining. Other BIZ, Aalto, and exchange students students can register for the course.

Optional course in Minor in Finance.

Possible to include this course as Finance MSc degree core course for students without bachelor's degree in finance from School of Business.
